Home → Events and activities → Suffolk Libraries Presents

Amazing performances and cultural events recorded live and screened at your library using top quality projection equipment.

Matthew Bourne's Cinderella at Debenham Library

Debenham Library · Fri 15 Feb 2019, 1930 · £5 in advance or £6 on the door
For tickets visit or call Debenham Library

A thrilling and evocative love story set in London during the Second World War.

Vienna State Opera House's Don Quixote - evening showing at Southwold Library

Southwold Library · Mon 4 Feb 2019, 1930 · £10, under 12s £8
For tickets visit or call Southwold Library

Experience the story of a world-famous ballet-classic played by the Orchestra of the Vienna State Opera - conducted by Kevin Rhodes - and marvellous dancers.

Vienna State Opera House's Don Quixote - matinee showing at Southwold Library

Southwold Library · Mon 4 Feb 2019, 1430 · £10, under 12s £8
For tickets visit or call Southwold Library

Experience the story of a world-famous ballet-classic played by the Orchestra of the Vienna State Opera - conducted by Kevin Rhodes - and marvellous dancers.

About

Suffolk Libraries Presents brings quality theatre and exhibition events to Suffolk communities using the latest digital screening equipment.

It’s funded by Arts Council England and runs in several of the county’s libraries with the aim of bringing more Suffolk residents into contact with the arts in a familiar and accessible local venue.

Digitally recorded, internationally acclaimed performance and exhibition events will be screened using the latest projection equipment in Southwold, Stradbroke, Felixstowe, Ixworth, Gainsborough, Hadleigh, Lowestoft and Capel St Mary libraries.

The performances will include the Globe Theatre’s productions of Julius Caesar and The Comedy of Errors; well-known ballets such as Matthew Bourne’s productions of Sleeping Beauty and Swan Lake; and unique, commentated tours of visual art exhibitions featuring artists such as Matisse, Rembrant and Van Gogh.

Partners

In partnership with Creative Arts East

Funded by Arts Council England
